intro: Astragalus harringtonii, commonly known as Harrington's milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus harringtonii plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native range.
